action.action-desc: Mr. Calvert (for himself, Mr. Carbajal, Mr. Fitzpatrick, and Mr. Lieu) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to issue guidance with respect to space systems, services, and technology as critical infrastructure, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Space Infrastructure Act.

section.header: Space systems, services, and technology as critical infrastructure

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this section, the Secretary shall designate space systems, services, and technology as a critical infrastructure sector.

Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this section, the Secretary, in consultation with relevant agencies and departments of the Federal Government, the Assistant to the President for Homeland Security and Counterterrorism, relevant Federal advisory committees, and the Executive Director, shall issue guidance with respect to designating space systems, services, and technology as critical infrastructure, including the following:

paragraph.text: Defining the scope of such sector, with consideration of satellites and space vehicles, space-related terrestrial systems and launch infrastructure, space-related production facilities, and applicable information technology.
Designating a Sector-Specific Agency for such sector.
Identifying appropriate committees and advisories to accompany such sector, including Government Coordinating Councils and Sector Coordinating Councils.

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the Secretary issues guidance pursuant to subsection (b), the Secretary shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report relating to the following:

paragraph.text: Any other information the Secretary determines appropriate.

subsection.text: Section 2001(3) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 601(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (O), (P), and (Q) as (P), (Q), and (R), respectively; and
by inserting after subparagraph (N) the following new subparagraph:
The term appropriate congressional committees means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate.

paragraph.text: The term critical infrastructure has the meaning given such term in section 1016(e) of the USA Patriot Act of 2001 (42 U.S.C. 5195c(e)).
The term Executive Director means the Executive Director of the Space Information Sharing and Analysis Center.
The term Sector-Specific Agency has the meaning given such term in Presidential Policy Directive 21 (February 12, 2013; relating to critical infrastructure security and resilience).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Homeland Security.
